columns.text: This exercise requires us to determine the sales for November and December and the cash collection for each month.
**Cash Collection**, often known as payment collection, is the process by which a company recovers money from customers or other businesses to whom it has given an invoice.

## Requirement a

First, let's identify the sales for November by dividing the difference between Accounts Receivable December and Uncollected December Sales by the collection rate two months after the sale.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Sales of November} &= \dfrac{\text{AR December - Uncollected December Sales}}{\text{Collection Rate}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{\$87,000 -  61,000 }}{\text{15\%}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{\$ 26,000 }}{\text{15\%}}\\[10pt]
&=\boxed{\textbf{\$ 173,333.33}}\\
\end{aligned}$$


**Therefore, the sales of November is $173,333.33.**

## Requirement b

Next, we will compute the sales of December by dividing the Uncollected December Sales by the total collection rate of one and two months after the sale.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Sales of November} &= \dfrac{\text{ Uncollected December Sales}}{\text{Collection Rate}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{61,000 }}{\text{20\% + 15\%}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{\$ 61,000 }}{\text{35\%}}\\[10pt]
&=\boxed{\textbf{\$ 174,285.71}}\\
\end{aligned}$$


**Therefore, the sales of December is $174,285.71.**

## Requirement c

Let's compute the cash collection from sales for each month from January through March. It is computed as follows:

$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{65\% of Current Sales}&&\text{\$ xxx}\\
\text{20\% of Last Months Sales}&&\text{xxx}\\
\text{15\% of Sales from 2 Months Ago}&&\underline{\text{ xxx}}\\
\text{Cash Collection}&&\underline{\underline{\$\hspace{5pt}\text{xxx}}}\\
\end{array}$$
